item.title: Pamela add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pamela add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I would like to see anyone, prophet, king or God, convince a thousand cats to do the same thing at the same time." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "As my father always used to tell me, 'You see, son, there's always someone in the world worse off than you.' And I always used to think, 'So?" -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "We started off trying to set up a small anarchist community, but people wouldn't obey the rules." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "If you were half as funny as you think you are, you'd be twice as funny as you are now." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Ever notice how 'What the hell' is always the right answer?" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "I saw the Cloud, though I did not foresee the Storm." -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Pamela add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think." -- A.A. Milne
